data.title: Lily Hampton
data.meta_description: Lily Rose Hampton is one of the main characters in So Awkward, portrayed by Cleo Demetriou. She is best known for her over-competitive and bossy nature. She is currently studying drama at Burke Hill University. Lily is bossy and overly-competitive. She likes to act as the leader of her friends...
data.text:
Lily Rose Hampton is one of the main characters in So Awkward, portrayed by Cleo Demetriou. She is best known for her over-competitive and bossy nature. She is currently studying drama at Burke Hill University.

Personality[]

Lily is bossy and overly-competitive. She likes to act as the leader of her friends and gives out orders. She is stubborn and does not like it when things are not done in the way she wants. When something is not done to her satisfaction, she will get into a mad rage; something she is famous for. Lily wants more than anything to look sophisticated and mature, which she does not succeed at, due to her brash and confident front that she tries so hard to portray.

In the first few series, Lily was hugely socially awkward, especially around boys. She had an obvious crush on Matt and could barely speak to him. After Matt leaves and Lily begins her relationship with Rob, her awkward personality seems to mellow out.

Lily has very high aspirations and is determined to reach them. However, because she tries to act older than her age, she comes off as immature, which becomes a barrier in her dreams to success. Sometimes, her dreams can be so wild that they get in the way of her friendships, making her prone to arguments and trying to win them.

She wants to fulfill her relationship with Rob and constantly is angered with his laid-back attitude and on several occasions has tried to get him to be more hot-headed.

Jas can also get on her nerves for her oddball attitude. Lily was very annoyed at Jas when Jas posted on her social media she was in love with Rob to try to explain why she stole the brooch Rob gave Lily.

She's obsessed with becoming a 'mature woman' and tends to try to speed up her growing up, which tends to end in disaster as she gets placed at odds with her boyfriend or one of her friends. She can also be very emotional over the smallest thing. It was shown that hormones hit her very hard in Series 3.

Lily is a very phobic person, having many irrational fears, as shown when Rob and Sid suggest having a scary party during Halloween.

Appearance[]

Lily has chocolate brown hair with blonde tips, and a memorable skinny face. Before, she often wore her hair down with a front braid, in a ponytail or side ponytail, though now, she often wears her hair out. She has a slim figure.

Roles[]

Series 1[]

Lily was often trying to get the attention of Matt Furnish during the first series. Lily would often copy the popular girls such as Natasha Jones and Jenny Jones Every time Matt gets a crush on someone else, she would actually try to break them up, as seen in the episode 'Rox My World'. At the end of the series, Matt kissed her and she felt that she had managed to get him to like her.

Series 2[]

In series 2, Lily was more determined to get Matt to be her boyfriend. She and Jas would often hatch plans to get Matt to talk to Lily or spend time with her. At the end of the series, Matt wanted to impress Scarlet Brooks and her gang by performing the guitar and singing during assembly. Lily told Matt that his song was lovely, despite it being horrible (she wanted to make him think that it was good so that he would embarrass himself in front of Scarlet.) Eventually, she cracked, telling him that the song was horrible. Matt then practiced, eventually getting it right. On the time of the performance, he lost his voice and Lily stepped in to sing while he played guitar. After, Matt was offered to hang out with Scarlet but he refused, claiming that he would hang out with Lily because she was his girlfriend.

Series 3[]

Sometime between series 2 and 3, Matt moved away which left her heartbroken and unable to speak for a week. Lily then met Rob Edwards, who she became girlfriend and boyfriend with. In series 3, Lily is very determined to keep her and Rob's relationship alive. She would go on and on about it that Cassie and Maxwell used her to study team relationships.

Series 4[]

In series 4, Lily became more bossy and obsessed with being the boss.

Series 5[]

In series 5, Lily worked as a waitress at Mugshotsz. In the first episode, she believed that she was superior to Jas but Lou told her that Jas was perfect. In the series 5 finale, she was upset that Martha was dating Gustav, who was a horrible person. She also tried to save Christmas by having an early Christmas party. In the end, Lily was happy and she attended the Christmas party at Mugshotsz.

Series 6[]

In series 6, Lily seemed to be focusing more on work. In the first episode, she fought Martha for the head girl crown, and even gained a lot of support from students despite Martha critising her by saying she isn't ready for becoming head girl and since Matt Furnish came into the scene, she has been an "ambition-free zone and goalless lackadaisical jelly".

Still So Awkward[]

At university, Lily attempts a new personality, which wears off in the first day. She is studying drama with famous actor Claire Fox. Her new friends include Frankie, Seb, Samson and Josh.

Trivia[]

Lily has automatonophobia (fear of ventriloquist dummies), formidophobia (fear of scarecrows), ichthyophobia (fear of fish) and a phobia of celery.[1]

She is the only main character from the series who returned in its successor series’ The second being Rufus.
